newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai baht rallies, interbank rate higher late.
newsitem.headline: Thai baht rallies, interbank rate higher late.

text.p: The Thai baht rallied against the dollar in late thin trade on Tuesday after tightened liquidity prompted dollar selling, dealers said.
The baht was traded at 25.890/25.895 to the dollar near the close against 25.900/25.905 in early trade, dealers said.
"Liquidity was tighter with rising interbank rates. This triggered some dollar selling for baht," one dealer at a foreign bank said.
The Bank of Thailand fixed the baht/dollar mid-rate unchanged at 25.86.
Lower money supply pushed the overnight interbank rate up to 13.00-14.00 percent in late trade from 12.00 earlier and 12.00-13.00 late on Monday, dealers said.
Liquidity ebbed as banks kept funds to meet festive cash withdrawals during the Lunar New Year and bank reserve requirement due on Friday, dealers said.
The one-month baht/dollar swap premium rose to 12.00/13.00 satangs per dollar late from 11.00/12.00 in the morning.
